Package Project1.StatsLibrary

Class StatsLibrary

java.lang.Object
Project1.StatsLibrary.StatsLibrary
public class StatsLibrary extends Object
This class provides a collection of statistical and probability functions.

      Parameters:

      b - The probability of event B.
      aAndB - The probability of the intersection of events A and B.

      Parameters:
      aAndB - The probability of the intersection of events A and B.
      b - The probability of event B.
      Returns:
      The conditional probability P(A|B).

      b - The probability of event B.

    • binomialDistribution

      public double binomialDistribution(double p, int n, int y)
      Calculates the probability of a specific outcome in a binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      p - The probability of success in a single trial.
      n - The number of trials.
      y - The number of successful outcomes desired.
      Returns:
      The probability of getting 'y' successful outcomes in 'n' trials with probability 'p'.

    • binomialExpectedValue

      Parameters:
      n - The number of trials.
      p - The probability of success in a single trial.
      Returns:
      The expected value (mean) of the binomial distribution.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      public double hypergeometricDistribution(int r, int y, int totalPop, int selectedPop)
      Calculates the Hypergeometric Distribution given N, n, r, and y.
      Parameters:
      r - Available type 1 items.
      y - Selected type 1 items.
      totalPop - The total population you are choosing from (N).
      selectedPop - The selected population (n).
      Returns:
      The Hypergeometric Distribution of the given variables.

      selectedPop - The selected population (n).

      Returns:

    • negativeBinomialDistribution

      public double negativeBinomialDistribution(double p, int r, int y)
      Calculate the probability of a negative binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      p - Probability of success in each trial.
      r - Number of successes.
      y - Total number of trials.
      Returns:
      Probability of getting 'r' successes in 'y' trials.

    • negativeBinomialExpectedValue

      public double negativeBinomialExpectedValue(double p, int r)
      Calculate the expected value of a negative binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      p - Probability of success in each trial.
      r - Number of successes.
      Returns:
      Expected number of trials required to achieve 'r' successes.

    • negativeBinomialVariance

      public double negativeBinomialVariance(double p, int r)
      Calculate the variance of a negative binomial distribution.
      Parameters:
      p - Probability of success in each trial.
      r - Number of successes required.
      Returns:
      Variance of the number of trials required to achieve 'r' successes.

      public double poissonDistribution(double lambda, int y)
      Calculates the Poisson distribution probability for a given lambda and value y.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The mean rate.
      y - The desired value for which the probability is calculated.
      Returns:
      The Poisson distribution probability for the given lambda and y.

    • poissonDistributionVariance

      public double poissonDistributionVariance(double lambda)
      Calculate the variance of a Poisson distribution.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The mean rate of the Poisson distribution.
      Returns:

      Calculate the expected value of a Poisson distribution.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The mean rate of the Poisson distribution.
      Returns:
      The expected value of the Poisson distribution.

    • chebyshevs

      public double chebyshevs(double upperBound, double lowerBound, double mean, double stdDev)
      Calculates the percentage of data within a specified range using Chebyshev's theorem.
      Parameters:
      upperBound - The upper bound of the desired range.
      lowerBound - The lower bound of the desired range.
      mean - The mean (average) of the data.
      stdDev - The standard deviation of the data.
      Returns:
      The percentage of data within the specified range.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the range is not symmetrical around the mean or if 'k' is not greater than one.
